Documentation¶

Package Components¶

The package Components contains both a data structure (SpatialImage) and functionalities dedicated to input/output operations (imread, imsave).

It consists in two modules : SpatialImage (see Module Spatial Image) and Input/Ouput (see Module Input/Output).

Module Spatial Image¶

This class allows a management of SpatialImage objects (2D and 3D images). A SpatialImage gathers a numpy array and some metadata (such as voxelsize, physical extent, origin, type, etc.). Through a numpy.ndarray inheritance, all usual operations on numpy.ndarray objects (sum, product, transposition, etc.) are available. All image processing operations are performed on this data structure, that is also used to solve inputs (read) and outputs (write).

class components.spatial_image.SpatialImage[source]¶
static __new__(input_array, origin=None, voxelsize=None, dtype=None, metadata_dict=None)[source]¶

SpatialImage constructor (2D and 3D images)

Parameters:
  • input_array (numpy.ndarray) – image
  • origin (list) – image origin, optional. Default: [0,0] or [0,0,0]
  • voxelsize (list) – image voxelsize, optional. Default: [1.0,1.0] or [1.0,1.0,1.0]
  • dtype (str) – image type, optional. Default: dtype=input_array.dtype
  • metadata_dict (dict) – image metadata, optional. Default: metadata_dict={}
Returns:SpatialImage instance – image and metadata 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image_1 = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> image_2 = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array, voxelsize=[0.5,0.5])
>>> isinstance(image_1, SpatialImage) and isinstance(image_2, SpatialImage)
True
equal(sp_img)[source]¶

Equality test between two SpatialImage

Parameters:sp_img (SpatialImage) – SpatialImage instance
Returns:True/False (bool) – if (array and metadata) are equal/or not 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image_1 = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> image_1==image_1
True
>>> image_2 = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array, voxelsize=[0.5,0.5])
>>> image_1==image_2
False
get_array()[source]¶

Get a numpy.ndarray from a SpatialImage

Returns:image_array (numpy.ndarray) – SpatialImage array 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> image_array = image.get_array()
>>> isinstance(image_array, SpatialImage)
False
>>> isinstance(image_array, np.ndarray)
True

Get SpatialImage dimension (2D or 3D image)

Returns:image_dim (int) – SpatialImage dimension 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> image_dim = image.get_dim()
>>> print image_dim
2

get_metadata()[source]¶

Get SpatialImage metadata

Returns:image_metadata (dict) – SpatialImage metadata 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> image_metadata = image.get_metadata()
>>> print image_metadata
{'dim': 2,
 'extent': [5.0, 5.0],
 'origin': [0, 0],
 'shape': (5, 5),
 'type': 'uint8',
 'voxelsize': [1.0, 1.0]
 }

Get SpatialImage pixel value

Parameters:indices (list) – indices as list of integers
Returns:pixel_value (self.get_type()) – pixel value 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> indices = [1,1]
>>> pixel_value = image.get_pixel(indices)
>>> print pixel_value
1

Extract a region

Parameters:indices (list) – indices as list of integers
Returns:out_sp_image (SpatialImage) – output SpatialImage 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> indices = [1,3,1,3]
>>> out_sp_image = image.get_region(indices)
>>> isinstance(out_sp_image, SpatialImage)
True

revert_axis(axis='z')[source]¶

Revert x, y, or z axis

Parameters:axis (str) – can be either ‘x’, ‘y’ or ‘z’
Returns:out_sp_image (SpatialImage) – SpatialImage instance 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array, voxelsize=[0.5, 0.5, 0.5])
>>> image.revert_axis(axis='y')

Set SpatialImage physical extent

Parameters:image_extent (list) – SpatialImage physical extent. Metadata are updated according to the new physical extent. 
>>> import numpy as np
>>> from timagetk.components import SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> image_extent = [10.0, 10.0]
>>> image.set_extent(image_extent)

>>> image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> indices = [1,1]

>>> image.set_pixel(indices, value)

Module Input/Output¶

This module allows a management of inputs and outputs (2D/3D images and metadata) through the functions imread and imsave. Supported formats are : [‘.tif’, ‘.tiff’, ‘.inr’, ‘.inr.gz’, ‘.inr.zip’].

components.io.imread(img_file)[source]¶

Read an image (2D/3D). The supported formats are : [‘.tif’, ‘.tiff’, ‘.inr’, ‘.inr.gz’, ‘.inr.zip’]

Parameters:image_path (str) – path to the image
Returns:sp_image (SpatialImage) – image and metadata (such as voxelsize, extent, type, etc.) 
>>> from timagetk.util import data_path
>>> from timagetk.components import imread, SpatialImage
>>> image_path = data_path('filtering_src.inr')
>>> sp_image = imread(image_path)
>>> isinstance(sp_image, SpatialImage)
True
components.io.imsave(img_file, sp_img)[source]¶

Save an image (2D/3D). The supported formats are : [‘.tif’, ‘.tiff’, ‘.inr’, ‘.inr.gz’, ‘.inr.zip’]

Parameters:
  • save_path (str) – save path
  • sp_image (SpatialImage) – SpatialImage instance
 
>>> from timagetk.util import data_path
>>> from timagetk.components import imsave, SpatialImage
>>> test_array = np.ones((5,5), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> sp_image = SpatialImage(input_array=test_array)
>>> save_path = data_path('test_output.tif')
>>> imsave(save_path, sp_image)

Package Plugins¶

Tissue Image Toolkit (timagetk) can be used with or without the plug-in architecture provided by OpenAleaLab and implemented within the platform TissueLab. TissueLab will automatically detect the presence of Tissue Image Toolkit as plugins. Note that these plugins can be used independently of the TissueLab environment.

Tissue Image Toolkit is based on a set of X groups of plugins whose API (Application Programming Interface) are standardized, and these groups provide an access to a total of X methods. The groups of plugins are:

  • Linear Filtering (9 methods, see Module Linear Filtering)
  • Grayscale Morphology (12 methods, see Module Grayscale Morphology)
  • Averaging (5 methods, see Module Averaging)
  • H-transform (2 methods, see Module H-transform)
  • Region Labeling (1 method, see Module Region Labeling)
  • Segmentation (1 method, see Module Segmentation)
  • Labels Post Processing (X methods, see Module Labels Post Processing)
  • Registration (3 methods, see Module Registration)
  • Sequence Registration (3 methods, see Module Sequence registration)
